item.title: we_have_returned
item.author: citysec@protonmail.com
item.description: We did a test trial last semester to weigh in on the interest in security. It was mostly during the evenings that we kept our meetings BUT, back by popular demand, we are having our meetings on Thursdays during club hours üéâ…

item.title: meeting_01
item.author: citysec@protonmail.com
item.description: Meeting 1 Recap üéâ We started out by covering some pros & cons for different linux distros. The main ideas were that Ubuntu is a great daily driver while still learning the nuances of linux. Ubuntu allows you to explore the depths of linux while still offering a safe haven to return to when things get scary. üò± It may be tempting to jump straight into Arch or Kali linux when practicing web security, but it’s more important to use your new favorite OS as your default computer and not as a specialty app that you just need for some wifi cracking.

item.title: about
item.author: citysec@protonmail.com
item.description: what we be about citySec was formed in the summer of 2018 to provide an ongoing outlet for the growing cybersecurity demand and presence at City College. citySec is a collective of cybersecurity enthusiasts. üíª citySec is for everyone. üë• citySec is fun… üé° so have fun with it! üéâ contact Please join our slack channel

item.title: team projects
item.author: citysec@protonmail.com
item.description: ** If you have a project you wish to advertise for collaboration, email us at citysec@protonmail.com and we’ll add you to the list! join a team, push some code, and hack: NetSec AppSec Operating Systems (kernel-level and user-level) Hardware Hacking Reverse Engineering Malware Analysis Cryptography Open Source Red Team vs. Blue team
